statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: San Francisco 85, Santa Clara 69
article.story: SAN FRANCISCO -- Cody Doolin scored a season-high 21 points, 12 of them in the final 6:03, and San Francisco beat Santa Clara 85-69 on Thursday night. Angelo Caloiaro had 18 points and 13 rebounds to help the Dons (16-10, 6-6 West Coast) erase an 11-point second-half deficit. Perris Blackwell added 18 points for San Francisco. The Broncos (8-16, 0-11) tied a 67-year-old school record with their 12th consecutive loss. Despite 21 points from Raymond Cowels III and 20 from Denzel Johnson, Santa Clara scored only nine points over an 11 1/2-minute stretch of the second half. San Francisco scored 34 points during that span to take control of the game. The Broncos shot a season-high 60.9 percent on 3-pointers (14 of 23) but undercut that efficiency with 21 turnovers, which led to 28 points for San Francisco.
